column4: your wireless isn't working?  broadcom 4318.  Have you tried ndiswrapper?
did you try ndiswrapper to get your broadcom 4318 wireless card working?
here are instructions for getting broadcom 4318 to work in ubuntu feisty: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=197102
thanks ill check it out
cause is still not working =S
basically you download this .deb file, double click it to install, and that's it: http://ubuntuforums.org/attachment.php?attachmentid=30328&d=1177147133
after that i keep on the link's manual??
I don't understand what you mean by link's manual
i mean what do i do after that??
download the .deb file to for example your desktop or your home folder, then go to the file so you can see it, then double click it and it should run an installer I think
yes it does
but whats next??
i don't know if you need to reboot or restart gnome, or go to system->administration->networking to see if wireless is already enabled.  I bet you have to restart though
ill restart... ill be back in a second if something goes wrong
thank you
that thread doesn't seem to be about the broadcom 4318, you mean this thread?: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=197102
in the Terminal (command line), you simply type "dmesg" and you can copy (select text and right click and choose copy)
after copying where do i paste it can you send me the link or whatever i need?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org

here's the paste bin "http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/36110/"
macd asked for your dmesg output, i don't see anything bad, i see the "bcm43xx driver" line
